question: x is a positive integer of t less than 500 . when x is divided by 7 , the remainder is 1 ; when x is divided by 3 , the remainder is 2 . how many x are there ?

of the diplomats who attended a summit conference : 20 spoke latin , 32 did not speak russian and 20 % of the diplomats spoke neither latin nor russian . if 10 % of the diplomats spoke both latin and russian , then how many diplomats attended the conference ?

a contractor undertakes to do a job within 100 days and hires 10 people to do it . after 20 days , he realizes that one fourth of the work is done so he fires 2 people . in how many more days g will the work get over ?

addison high school ’ s senior class has 300 boys and 240 girls . if 60 % of the boys attended the college then 60 % of the total class attended college , what percentage of the girls class attended college ?
the average of 60 results is 40 and the average of other 40 results is 60 . what is the average of all the results ?
the positive numbers w , x , y , and z are such that x is 40 percent greater than y , y is 20 percent greater than z , and w is 20 percent less than x . what percent greater than z is w ?

a rectangular tiled patio is composed of 40 square tiles . the rectangular patio will be rearranged so that there will be 2 fewer columns of tiles and 4 more rows of tiles . after the change in layout , the patio will still have 40 tiles , and it will still be rectangular . how many rows are in the tile patio before the change in layout ?

a lemonade stand sold only small and large cups of lemonade on tuesday . 1 / 5 of the cups sold were small and the rest were large . if the large cups were sold for 7 / 6 as much as the small cups , what fraction of tuesday ' s total revenue was from the sale of large cups ?
find the largest 3 digit number which is exactly divisible by 88 ?
how much more would rs . 40000 fetch , after two years , if it is put at 20 % p . a . compound interest payable half yearly than if is put at 20 % p . a . compound interest payable yearly ?

bill and jane play a simple game involving two fair dice , each of which has 6 sides numbered from 1 to 6 ( with an equal chance of landing on any side ) . bill rolls the dice and his score is the total of the two dice . jane then rolls the dice and her score is the total of her two dice . if jane ’ s score is higher than bill ’ s , she wins the game . what is the probability the jane will win the game ?
